Data: McGrath to Strauss, no run
McGrath to Strauss, 1 run tighter onto the pads this time, and tickled away to fine leg to get off the mark
McGrath to Vaughan, no run this time it's outside Vaughan's off stump, gently swinging towards the slips, and left well alone
McGrath to Vaughan, 1 wide wider, and called as much. McGrath mutters to himself as he huffs back to his mark. Oh the indignity
McGrath to Vaughan, 1 run straying onto the right-hander's pads, and clipped into space at midwicket. Both openers are up and running
McGrath to Strauss, no run
McGrath to Strauss, no run a good ball to finish, just short of a length, in that corridor, and Strauss lets it go with the bat tucked inside the line
Bracken to Vaughan, 1 bye oops, a rare fumble from Adam Gilchrist lets the batsmen cross for a single. Not the tidiest ball ever delivered, in fairness
Bracken to Strauss, 1 run opens the face, and runs this one down to third man

Bracken to Vaughan, FOUR runs the first boundary of the day, and appropriately - in the context of England's summer so far - it's a streaky one! Inside-edge of a forward defensive, and it flies down to fine leg
Bracken to Vaughan, no run good length again, turned off the pads but straight to midwicket
Bracken to Vaughan, no run
Bracken to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Strauss, no run
McGrath to Strauss, no run
McGrath to Strauss, no run
McGrath to Strauss, 2 runs
McGrath to Strauss, 3 runs
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
Bracken to Strauss, no run
Bracken to Strauss, no run
Bracken to Strauss, no run
Bracken to Strauss, no run
Bracken to Strauss, FOUR runs well played, uses the pace of the ball to run it past backward point. There we go, I remembered that one
Bracken to Strauss, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, 1 run
McGrath to Strauss, 1 run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
Bracken to Strauss, no run
Bracken to Strauss, no run
Bracken to Strauss, OUT
Bracken to Bell, FOUR runs
Bracken to Bell, no run
Bracken to Bell, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, 1 run
McGrath to Bell, no run
Bracken to Vaughan, FOUR runs
Bracken to Vaughan, 2 runs
Bracken to Vaughan, no run Nearly back up to date - bet you can't wait!
Bracken to Vaughan, no run
Bracken to Vaughan, no run
Bracken to Vaughan, 1 run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run
McGrath to Vaughan, no run tight wicket-to-wicket delivery, and turned into the slips
McGrath to Vaughan, FOUR runs
McGrath to Vaughan, no run beautiful shot! That's vintage Vaughan, short of a length and pulled imperiously in front of square. The best shot he's played in Australia for four years, I'll wager
McGrath to Vaughan, 2 runs
McGrath to Vaughan, FOUR runs a wide swinging half-volley from McGrath, and Vaughan is onto it like a flash, square-driving all the way to the fence. Kum-bya-yar Michael Vaughan!
Bracken to Bell, no run
Bracken to Bell, 3 runs
Bracken to Vaughan, 2 runs
Bracken to Vaughan, OUT
Bracken to Pietersen, no run

Bracken to Pietersen, no run right, we are officially back up to speed. What a total shambles. Apologies for all that, but it's the end of the first powerplay, and time to take stock. A decent start for England by their recent standards, but Michael Vaughan's dismissal for 26 has tilted the balance to Australia
McGrath to Bell, no run time to regroup for England, and for Cricinfo, and Bell starts with a watchful defensive stroke
McGrath to Bell, no run wicket-to-wicket delivery, and another perpendicular face of the bat
McGrath to Bell, 1 run wider this time, and slapped into the covers to bring the big dog, KP, onto strike
McGrath to Pietersen, 3 runs a thickish outside-edge to get off the mark, beats the field but pulls up inside the rope
McGrath to Bell, no run up and onto his toes, and driven square to a diving Michael Clarke at point, who roars with anguish that he failed to field it cleanly. Perfectionists, these Aussies.
McGrath to Bell, no run outside off stump, and left well alone
Bracken to Pietersen, 1 run a controlled slash from Pietersen goes straight through the gap at fourth slip, and arrives at third man on the second bounce
Bracken to Bell, 1 run
Bracken to Pietersen, no run driven firmly, but can't beat the field
Bracken to Pietersen, no run good length delivery and a hurried defensive prod
Bracken to Pietersen, no run lovely delivery! Saw Pietersen looking to advance, and hit the deck extra hard, with the ball zipping off a good length and just missing the edge of the bat
Bracken to Pietersen, no run defensive once again, and a slight inside-edge onto the pads. Lovely over
Clark to Bell, no run nice start from Clark - just back of a length, wobbly seam, watchful defence
Clark to Bell, no run more of the same. He's found that awkward length already
Clark to Bell, no run slightly wider this time, but a checked drive can't beat the field
Clark to Bell, no run fuller and straighter onto the pads, and clipped to the man at short midwicket
Clark to Bell, no run nothing more than the basics here for Clark, but they are mighty effective. Back of a length once again, and a dot ball once again
Clark to Bell, 1 run slightly shorter, jabbing up towards Bell's ribs, and that's fended away for a scampered single. The end of a lovely tight over
Johnson to Bell, no run fast arm, but a bit wide of off stump first up. Left well alone
Johnson to Bell, no run
Johnson to Bell, no run awkward lifter, again on off stump. Bell negotiates with a flick of the wrists into the gully again
Johnson to Bell, no run more comfortable line and length for the batsman, and that's pushed coolly into the covers
Johnson to Bell, no run swinging into the pads, Bell misses out on a flick through midwicket
Johnson to Bell, no run a more forceful, front-foot drive, but again, there's no beating the field. A maiden to start Johnson's spell
Clark to Pietersen, no run on the pads and flicked away, but a brilliant sprawling stop from Ponting at midwicket. The Aussies are electric in the field
Clark to Pietersen, no run he's on the walk again, three casual steps down the track, followed by a cool pushed defence.
Clark to Pietersen, no run opens the face and plays into the gully
Clark to Pietersen, 2 runs on the pads again, and flicked in the air through the vacant square leg
Clark to Pietersen, 1 wide leg side and called. A rare aberration
Clark to Pietersen, 1 run down the pitch again, and tucked away to midwicket
Clark to Bell, no run not an easy time out there for Bell at the moment. He's a bit fidgetty at the crease and can't get this one away through the gully
Johnson to Pietersen, no run leg-side, and played off the back foot to midwicket
Johnson to Pietersen, no run a wild flog of a shot through the covers, but again KP can't beat the field. It's a war of attrition out there
Johnson to Pietersen, no run KP tries to find room in the gully this time, but can't
Johnson to Pietersen, no run the frustration is palpable. Still no way through. Johnson hasn't conceded a run in ten deliveries
Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs he has now! And it's a streaky slash through the vacant slip cordon, and all the way to the boundary. Well, they all count
Johnson to Pietersen, no run another rash drive, but this time the ball fizzes through to the keeper. Another fine over
Clark to Bell, FOUR runs at last, some welcome runs for Bell, steered past point to the boundary
Clark to Bell, 1 run on the back foot, turned to short midwicket
Clark to Pietersen, no run lovely delivery. Tight on the stumps, Pietersen can only offer a straight bat, and he's lucky not to get the edge as the ball whistles through

Clark to Pietersen, FOUR runs that's the shot! He's been looking for that one ever since he came to the crease, but this time Pietersen walks straight into an effortless straight drive. He's starting to find his range now ...
Clark to Pietersen, 1 run on the back foot again, and tucked to midwicket
Clark to Bell, no run outside off stump, and left well alone
Johnson to Pietersen, no run shuffled across his stumps and picked up at midwicket
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run good length delivery, driven straight down the ground. Cut off by mid-off, but he can't stop the single

Johnson to Bell, OUT Gottim! And you have to say that was coming! Johnson's been turning the screw superbly since he came on, and this time Bell couldn't hold himself back - down the track, and a loose drive straight to mid-off, comfortably lodged in Mike Hussey's midriff
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 1 run off the mark instantly with a nudge through square leg, but England have a bit of regrouping to do here
Johnson to Pietersen, no run
Johnson to Pietersen, 3 runs not timed, but effective as the ball pulls up inside the fine leg rope. How much now rests on this man ...
Clark to Pietersen, no run lodged on the back foot, and unable to find any gaps at midwicket
Clark to Pietersen, no run

Clark to Pietersen, 2 runs not the best of throws, and Collingwood quite possibly should have been on his way there! Back for two, and Hayden's throw from mid-on has the batsman sprawling at the non-striker's end
Clark to Pietersen, 2 runs another flick, another couple of runs, but safer this time as the throw comes in from deep midwicket
Clark to Pietersen, no run onto the back foot and defended watchfully
Clark to Pietersen, no run onto the front foot, by way of a change, but it's the same result&
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run outside off stump, Collingwood takes a swish but the ball keeps a touch low and scuttles through to the keeper
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run brilliantly nagging line-and-length bowling going on here. Collingwood connects this time, but can't apply any pace to the ball
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run still in that off-stump corridor, and defended with a late shuffle
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run banged in back of a length, angled across towards the slips. And another dot ball
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run on the legs, but still no way to whip it away. England are under the cosh here
Clark to Pietersen, 1 run trouble here! Ponting dives, fields, rolls and flings, but just misses the stumps from midwicket. Collingwood would have been out for all money. Brilliant stuff
Clark to PD Collingwood, no run more watchful in defence, as Collingwood continues to struggle to double his runs tally&
Clark to PD Collingwood, 1 run nudged into the leg side with minimal foot movement, and there it is. He's doubled his tally
Clark to Pietersen, FOUR runs Shot! A perfect straight drive - an easy stride followed by a full flowing bat. Shaves the stumps at the non-striker's end, and all the way to the fence
Clark to Pietersen, no run more brilliant fielding, this time from Andrew Symonds in the covers
Clark to Pietersen, (no ball) 1 run tucked off the hips to keep the strike, but it's a no-ball, so one more to come
Clark to PD Collingwood, no run firm wallop through the off side, but nicely intercepted at point by Michael Clarke
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run more positive intent from Pietersen as he comes down the track, and edges a drive down to third man
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run pushed to cover, but with no power
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run lovely ball, gently but deceptively swinging, and beats Collingwood's loose drive
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 2 runs up in the air ... but safe! That was a loose pull from Collingwood, but it spiralled just out of the reach of Symonds, running back from mid-on
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 1 run good length again, and pushed into the leg side
Clark to PD Collingwood, no run solid back-foot defence. But solidity isn't the be-all and end-all
Clark to PD Collingwood, no run pushed into the covers once again. God, England are rubbish at one-dayers
Clark to PD Collingwood, 1 run on the back foot, and turned to square leg
Clark to Pietersen, no run a big hooning drive, but again no timing. Picked up in the covers, as the pressure ticks up again
Clark to Pietersen, no run back and defends. At least there are still wickets intact
Clark to Pietersen, 1 run driven into the gap at long-on, but no freebies on offer
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run glanced to backward square leg
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run nope, no way through there
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run nor there. Lovely tight bowling from Johnson. That left-arm angle is toying with Collingwood's mind
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run opens the face and attempts to pick up a single, but Pietersen rightly sends him back

Johnson to PD Collingwood, 2 runs oooh ... lucky lucky! Fended into space behind point, but Collingwood should have been run out as he dived for his second run. The pressure is really telling out there for England
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 2 runs a thickish drive brings up England's 100
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run tidy loop and decent line,
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run flighted delivery and pushed into the covers
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run more width this time, but the same result. Pressure, pressure
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run good loop and flight, and glanced down to fine leg
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run full onto the stumps and pushed into the covers
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run slower delivery, and a mistimed flick is the result from Collingwood
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 1 run
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run back of a length and slapped out to the cover sweeper
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 2 runs a rare couple for the struggling Collingwood, who slaps the ball off the front foot to cover
Johnson to PD Collingwood, no run lovely ball, angled away from the right-hander, and just eludes the edge as well
Clarke to Pietersen, no run
Clarke to Pietersen, no run
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run good flight and loop, Clarke is not afraid to tease the England batsmen at the moment
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run down on one knee and paddled away for a single
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run another paddle, and another single.
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run cut, or late cut, but straight to point. Still can't find the gap
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run full and straight, clipped down to mid-on
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run fuller still and Collingwood times this back to the bowler
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run on leg stump this time but Collingwood, despite whipping it forcefully off the back foot, can't find the gap at midwicket
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run and it's a touch shorter this time, Collingwood goes for a delicate late glance but misses
Bracken to PD Collingwood, 1 run and eventually he gets a run, clunking it off the back foot - but the length was again excellent from Bracken and Collingwood can't time it
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run swept without power to a short fine leg
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run ooh, lovely shot punching it straight down the ground but just for a single
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 2 runs delicately reverse swept down to third man
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run ooh and he goes for it again but misses, and is hit on the pad
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run punched down the ground
Clarke to Pietersen, no run excellently bowled

Bracken to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs whipped off his legs to White at deep midwicket, it's in the air and going straight down his throat - but no! The sun beats him! He makes a total hash of it, ducking his head and the ball bobbles over for four
Bracken to PD Collingwood, 1 run worked off his pads for a single
Bracken to Pietersen, 1 run pushed down the ground
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run good, tight bowling
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run driven on the front foot but straight to cover
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run a little wider of the off stump but it's just short of a length and Collingwood can't time it. Again.
Clarke to Pietersen, no run Pietersen has absolutely hammered this straight back to Clarke...bump ball, but that would've stung
Clarke to Pietersen, no run on leg stump and he works it to leg
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run just a touch shorter of a length and it's punched off the back foot through midwicket
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run and he meets the length of this, sweeping it fine - timing it nicely, too
White to PD Collingwood, no run just outside off, the googly which Collingwood reads - I think - and he cuts it without timing
White to PD Collingwood, 1 run full, on middle stump and it's well timed down the ground
White to Pietersen, no run Pietersen comes down the track but White sees him and it hits his pad
White to Pietersen, no run just outside off, the big non-turner from White again and Pietersen prods it to cover
White to Pietersen, no run Pietersen comes massively forward, driving to mid on
White to Pietersen, 2 runs worked through midwicket and they scamper two
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 2 runs neatly swept to fine leg, who is quite deep, for two
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run timed, not whacked, to cover
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run half a shuffle down the pitch from Pietersen but Clarke adjusts his length and the batsman can only clunk it to mid on
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run pushed to mid on
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run defended on the front foot
White to Pietersen, no run Pietersen comes down the track to make this into a full bunger, but it hits too high on the bat and it's clunked to mid on
White to Pietersen, 1 run defended on the front foot
White to PD Collingwood, 1 run ooh, a nice bit of indrift but Pietersen clunks it to mid on
White to Pietersen, SIX runs bash! That's the way to do it, hitting it over extra cover - high and handsome for six. That was a beaut.
White to Pietersen, 1 run pushed down the ground
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run down the pitch confidently and punched to long on
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run and Collingwood comes down the pitch this time but can only push it back to the bowler
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run expansively driven but straight to cover
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run a very nice late cut, delicately played
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run the wrong line from Clarke, drifting down leg and it's easily turned round the corner for a single
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run down the pitch and pushed, without great power or timing, for a single
White to Pietersen, 2 runs swept on the full down to fine leg, very well played
White to Pietersen, no run down the pitch and Pietersen pings this straight into Collingwood's knee. Ouch. Just short of the knee in fact
White to Pietersen, SIX runs oh yes, that's massive. Ping pang, and Pietersen smashes this over long on
White to Pietersen, SIX runs here we go! Straighter this time, Pietersen crashes it over the bowler's head, flatter. But the same result
White to Pietersen, no run timed down - and along - the ground
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run punched down the ground on the front foot
Clarke to Pietersen, no run that's the right length, nice and full and straight
Clarke to Pietersen, no run on leg stump and it's well timed, albeit without much power, to long on
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run ooh and Pietersen shuffles across, and down, the pitch and sweeps it to fine leg
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run an ugly reverse sweep from Collingwood. Not timed
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run down the pitch but Collingwood again can't time it
McGrath to PD Collingwood, 2 runs full, on off stump and Collingwood check-drives this past McGrath, down the ground and Mitchell Johnson sprints from long-on to save four. Excellent fielding
McGrath to PD Collingwood, OUT the slower ball from McGrath, Collingwood picks it but can't execute this lofted shot as well as he might and it's hit straight to Johnson at long on
McGrath to Flintoff, no run ooh and a welcoming bouncer from McGrath, Flintoff ducks out of the way
McGrath to Flintoff, no run well bowled! Full, inswinging yorker which Flintoff digs out
McGrath to Flintoff, no run oh dear, a very ugly, concrete-footed swish outside his off stump from Flintoff

McGrath to Flintoff, no run angled off the back foot to Clarke at backward point. They go for a single, oh no they don't - Clarke sends in a throw and Pietersen dives back in his crease at the non-striker's end
Clarke to Pietersen, no run
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run full and straight and hit down the ground once more, but without sufficient power
Clarke to Flintoff, 1 run drifting down the leg side and Flintoff turns his wrists, placing this through midwicket for a single
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run he stands tall here, elegantly driving it down the ground
Clarke to Flintoff, FOUR runs slog swept with immense power over deep midwicket. Calmly, solidly smashed
Clarke to Flintoff, no run defended on the front foot
McGrath to Pietersen, no run ooh, excellent bouncer which is quickly evaded by the batsman
McGrath to Pietersen, 1 run shot! What an extraordinary shot just for a single, down the pitch and slapping it through midwicket
McGrath to Flintoff, 1 run swinging into Flintoff's pads who gives himself a touch of room outside leg, opening the face and guiding it to cover
McGrath to Pietersen, no run smashed with a flourish but he can't find the gap at extra cover
McGrath to Pietersen, 2 runs deliciously driven down the ground with the straightest of bats. Again, a marvellous shot just for a single though

McGrath to Pietersen, no run ouch. Pietersen skips down the pitch to a bouncer and is struck in the chest. Gilchrist pops over for a sledge, as does McGrath and Symonds makes it a trio of insults. No surprise there, given how Pietersen has skipped down the wicket to McGrath all summer (or winter, depending where you live). It just bounced a touch too much, cannoning into his
McGrath to Dalrymple, no run right on the money as usual, just outside off stump and this one cuts back into the batsman who defends off the back foot
McGrath to Dalrymple, no run boshed to mid off but it's Michael Clarke positioned there...not a man you take a single to

McGrath to Dalrymple, OUT down the leg side, Dalymple tries to hook this and misses. Gilchrist politely asks the umpire who, after a couple of seconds, raises his finger! What a shocker that is. Replays indicate the ball hit his helmet, and Dalrymple trudges off fairly fuming
McGrath to Lewis, 1 run oh nicely played from Lewis, just angling this down to third man
McGrath to Flintoff, no run excellent bowling, an inswinging yorker which Flintoff digs out back to the bowler
McGrath to Flintoff, 1 run again it's too full for Flintoff to get hold of it and he can only clunk it into the covers
Clark to Flintoff, 1 run the full bunger on leg stump which hurries Flintoff somewhat, who turns it through midwicket looking for two...but only a single is on offer
Clark to Lewis, 1 leg bye full, into Lewis's pads who is beaten by the inswing. Startled, he realises the ball has bobbled out into the off side and Flintoff hurries him through for a single
Clark to Flintoff, FOUR runs bish bash bosh! Just short of a length, in Flintoff's area and he simply lifts this just wide of long-on for a resounding four
Clark to Flintoff, 2 runs pushed through midwicket for a single. Oh, they're going for two and they get it comfortably
Clark to Flintoff, 1 run swinging into Flintoff's pads, a full toss which he bashes down the ground
Clark to Lewis, 1 run again a full toss
Johnson to Flintoff, no run clunked into the covers
Johnson to Flintoff, 1 run Flintoff waits for this on the back foot and bashes it off the back foot through the covers
Johnson to Pietersen, no run shorter, Pietersen tries to pull but can't time it
Johnson to Pietersen, no run glanced off the back foot
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run angled behind square, Clarke is so quick to run round, picks up one-handed and sends in a decent throw
Johnson to Flintoff, 1 run pushed into the covers
Clark to Flintoff, 1 wide swinging away down the leg side. Not quite the start we've come to expect
Clark to Flintoff, 2 runs good length delivery, heaved to long-on, and McGrath fumbles to make a second a formality
Clark to Flintoff, FOUR runs a low full-bunger, and clobbered straight down the ground with immense power and timing! Shot, Freddie!
Clark to Flintoff, 1 run wild swish and a top-edge, but it lands safe and sound. Flintoff fights on
Clark to Pietersen, 1 run down on one knee and an extravagant drive, followed by a grimace. Those ribs are still smarting
Clark to Flintoff, 1 run attempted yorker, punched into space on the leg-side. Useful stand building here
Clark to Pietersen, 1 run cracked rib or no cracked rib. That's another single
McGrath to Lewis, 1 run very full, swinging into Lewis who tries to smear it through cover but gets a thin edge, falling short of Gilchrist, and they manage to steal a single
McGrath to Flintoff, 1 run forced past extra cover for a single
McGrath to Lewis, 1 run well bowled! Excellent cricket from McGrath, full, straight, swinging into Lewis who, to his credit, dug this out well
McGrath to Flintoff, 1 run again it's a touch too full from McGrath and Flintoff is cramped for room, just meekly prodding it down to long-on for another single
McGrath to Lewis, 2 runs reasonably aggressive shot from Lewis, giving himself room and hitting over the top
McGrath to Lewis, 1 run smeared through cover
Bracken to Lewis, 2 runs clunked into the covers

Bracken to Lewis, OUT what a catch! A full toss which Lewis sliced off a thick outside edge just to Ponting's right at backward point, and he dived brilliantly taking the ball horizontally, one-handed. Quite superb fielding
Bracken to Flintoff, 2 runs Flintoff pumps this down the ground to long-on, oh and they're going for two - Symonds throws to the wrong end, and Monty is like grease lightning between the wickets
Bracken to Flintoff, FOUR runs shot! Freddie steps outside his off stump and swivels this over deep midwicket. Fabulous
Bracken to Flintoff, 2 runs again steps outside his off stump, meets this on the full and it's timed through midwicket - and they steal a single. Oh no, they're going for two
Bracken to Flintoff, 2 runs pushed through the covers

And there ends England's innings. Everything looked possible while Pietersen was at the crease and, as ever, he played excellently. Flintoff looked in good touch too but the constant tumbling of wickets at the other end prevented him from getting away from Australia. All in all, a very fine performance from Australia's bowlers. That's it from me. Join Andrew after the innings break
Here's the metronomic Jon Lewis to restore order
Flintoff to Gilchrist, 1 wide wide of the off stump, very wide in fact. Two bounces to the keeper
Flintoff to Gilchrist, 5 wide oops, that's awful. Leg-side and swinging and all the way to the boundary
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run almost another one, taken in front of first slip by a tumbling Nixon
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run short of a length, pushed into the covers.
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run more of the same, better line
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run wide and slashed, and a big ooh from the keeper
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run
Flintoff to Gilchrist, 5 wide that's poor, poor bowling. Wide and loose, and deflected past first slip by the keeper
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run and a dot to finish a frenetic first over!
Lewis to Hayden, no run that's the way to do it, good line, good length, respectfully played
Lewis to Hayden, 1 run too straight, and glanced fine for the first runs off the bat
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run that's the spot. Tight on middle and off
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run steady and on the spot from Lewis
Lewis to Gilchrist, 1 run bit too straight again, and worked off the pads
Lewis to Hayden, 1 wide a bit wild from Lewis again, and England's extras tally in 2007 is already out of control
Lewis to Hayden, 1 wide oh deary me. Leg-side, swinging, rubbish. England's competitive 242 is already an insubstantial 229
Lewis to Hayden, no run back on the spot at last. Indifferent stuff from England!

Flintoff to Gilchrist, FOUR runs that is a beautiful shot! Once again, a bit too wide from Flintoff, and that was cracked on the up, off the back foot, with a ramrod straight bat, clean through the covers
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run tighter line, but it's all relative. England are all over the place at the moment
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run cracked off the back foot, too wide, and smashed to gully
Flintoff to Gilchrist, 3 runs and he gives himself a touch of room, crashing this through extra cover for three. Really well timed, and Mahmood gives chase
Flintoff to Hayden, no run
Flintoff to Hayden, no run a tighter line this time, just outside off stump and Hayden lunges forward, defending on the front foot - albeit with a closed face of the bat
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run trundly pace and a fraction too much width. Nudged down to third man for a single
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run back of a length and pushed to cover
Lewis to Gilchrist, 1 bye another fumble from cymbals Nixon, on his ODI debut. Late swing deceived him there
Lewis to Hayden, 1 leg bye shapes to play a pull, and deflects off his ample midriff for a single
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run a modicum of control now being applied by England. Not before time
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run outside off stump again, left well alone and through to the keeper. Tidier over, just two runs coming from it
Anderson to Hayden, 1 run pushed into the gap and they cross for a single
Anderson to Gilchrist, no run good full length, and was that a hint of swing? Conceivably ...
Anderson to Gilchrist, FOUR runs no swing on that occasion, only a full swing of the bat as an Anderson long-hop is deposited over midwicket.
Anderson to Gilchrist, 1 run a bit of a scamper there for Gilchrist as Flintoff shies from mid-off and hits as well. But the batsman is safely home.
Anderson to Hayden, 1 leg bye short and slightly leg-side, but Hayden misses out with a swivel-pull. One more to the tally though, as the ball bobbles into no-man's land

Anderson to Gilchrist, 1 run fuller length, and played slightly uneasily by Gilchrist, who looks back in alarm as he loses sight of the ball. No dangers though, and he's called through. Good running between these two, as ever
Lewis to Gilchrist, FOUR runs width, and flogged over the covers. Didn't quite time it, but no matter - it's four
Lewis to Gilchrist, FOUR runs now that's timing! A fraction too full, and a free swing of the blade sends the ball spiralling over Flintoff's head at long-on!
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run tighter, but the intent is still there from a pumped-up Gilly
Lewis to Gilchrist, 1 run width again, and heaved into the off side. Just bounces short of Panesar at deep point
Lewis to Hayden, no run at last, some respite for England, as the less frenetic Hayden comes onto strike
Lewis to Hayden, no run good finish, but another loose over for England. Australia already in absolute command of this run-chase
Anderson to Gilchrist, no run left alone outside off. Good line, that
Anderson to Gilchrist, no run full and swinging away, drilled square but fielded at point
Anderson to Gilchrist, no run better stuff from Anderson. Consistent line and length, and a bit of disconcerting movement too.
Anderson to Gilchrist, no run zippy line and length, and that's respectfully defended with Gilchrist up on his toes. Now, can he finish his good work this over?
Anderson to Gilchrist, 3 runs good ball, but an even better stroke from Gilchrist, and a comedy attempt at a relay throw as Panesar fumbles a lob back from the deep midwicket rope
Anderson to Hayden, no run tidy over, and some good movement through the air. There is a bit of assistance going on out there
Lewis to Gilchrist, 1 run launched into the leg-side, and Mahmood fields well, stooping with one hand to cut off a certain boundary
Lewis to Hayden, no run pushed to cover off the front foot

Lewis to Hayden, FOUR runs short, and clobbered through midwicket with a flat bat! Hayden advanced, Lewis saw him coming, but his attempt to drag the ball down merely turned into the juiciest of long-hops
Lewis to Hayden, (no ball) oops, another extra to the tally. Otherwise a tidy length as Hayden leaves well alone
Lewis to Hayden, no run Action replay, minus the overstep, of course
Lewis to Hayden, 1 run turned to square leg
Lewis to Gilchrist, 1 run back of a length, scampered single
Anderson to Gilchrist, 2 runs flicked off the back foot, finds the gap at fine leg
Anderson to Gilchrist, FOUR runs and yet more clobberage! Full length, even fuller swing of the blade, rockets to the long-off fence
Anderson to Gilchrist, no run nicely angled into the left-hander, and pushed back down the pitch
Anderson to Gilchrist, no run the round-the-wicket line is working to Gilchrist. Though we've heard that refrain before ...
Anderson to Gilchrist, 1 run bit too much width, and a quick-footed cut to third man
Anderson to Hayden, no run straighter and on a good length. Met with a solid defence
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run that's better already. Well, at least it was a dot ball
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run tighter line, and solidly played. Well fielded in Flintoff's followthrough
Flintoff to Gilchrist, 1 run pushed onto the back foot, and flicked to midwicket for one
Flintoff to Hayden, no run shoulders arms outside off stump. Better from Flintoff
Flintoff to Hayden, 1 run fuller length, on off stump. Drilled into the deep where the cover sweeper tidies up
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run
Anderson to Hayden, 1 run ooh, a thick edge, but safe and away down to third man
Anderson to Gilchrist, 1 run tighter, and respectfully played
Anderson to Hayden, FOUR runs wham! Too much width, and that's launched over the covers with a full-blooded swing!
Anderson to Hayden, 1 run shuffles across and played out to deep midwicket
Anderson to Gilchrist, FOUR runs short and hammered up and over midwicket, and crosses the rope on the second bounce. Loose stuff again from England
Anderson to Gilchrist, no run
Flintoff to Hayden, FOUR runs yet more runs! Short and pulled in front of square - it looked like it came off the toe, but pretty effective nonetheless. Pure power
Flintoff to Hayden, 1 run
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run
Flintoff to Gilchrist, SIX runs blimey! That's huge! A vast swing of the blade, and that's still going up as it crosses the rope at long-on. Nice catch in the crowd, by a bloke on his mobile phone!
Flintoff to Gilchrist, no run a dot ball. Some respite for England
Flintoff to Gilchrist, 2 runs short of a length, and outside off stump, and cut away for two more. England are leaking runs all over the place at the moment. Did I say leaking? It's a torrent
Panesar to Hayden, 1 run good flight and a decent length to start from Monty
Panesar to Gilchrist, 2 runs and there's his fifty! Well batted Gilly. Brought up with a nudge into the covers. It's his 47th in ODI cricket, which ain't a bad return&
Panesar to Gilchrist, no run width, and slapped behind point
Panesar to Gilchrist, 3 runs
Panesar to Hayden, no run
Panesar to Hayden, no run
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run outside off stump, and pushed away without much fuss
Lewis to Gilchrist, FOUR runs
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run
Lewis to Gilchrist, 2 runs
Lewis to Gilchrist, no run
Panesar to Hayden, no run pushed out to cover
Panesar to Hayden, no run turned off his legs but straight to midwicket
Panesar to Hayden, no run got him! Gilchrist goes for the late cut but gets a thick outside edge to Nixon, behind the stumps, who takes an excellent catch
Panesar to Hayden, FOUR runs oh, what a shot
Panesar to Hayden, no run on off stump, turning back into the batsman who turns his wrists
Panesar to Hayden, no run defended on the front foot
Dalrymple to Gilchrist, no run and it's outside his off stump, Gilchrist goes back and defends off the back foot
Dalrymple to Gilchrist, no run got him! Outside Gilchrist's off stump, it turns a fraction away from his attempted cut stroke...a thick outside edge to Nixon who takes a fine catch. Big wicket
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run pushed through midwicket
Dalrymple to Ponting, 1 run clonked into the covers
Dalrymple to Hayden, no run defended on the front foot
Panesar to Ponting, 2 runs too short and it's easily paddled by Ponting around the corner
Panesar to Ponting, 1 run nice length from Monty, just outside his off stump and Ponting pushes this out into the covers
Panesar to Hayden, no run pushed through midwicket
Panesar to Hayden, no run defended on the back foot
Panesar to Hayden, no run and he comes down the pitch to defend
Panesar to Hayden, no run and it's pushed to leg to end the over
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run on off stump, defended on the front foot
Dalrymple to Ponting, 3 runs cut off the back foot into the covers
Dalrymple to Hayden, 1 run two runs through midwicket. Very well run
Dalrymple to Ponting, 1 run again too short, Ponting has plenty of time to rock back and nudge it to leg
Dalrymple to Hayden, no run on leg stump, Hayden comes forward, massively, and times it down the ground
Dalrymple to Hayden, 3 runs miles wide of the leg stump, Hayden flicks this down to fine leg
Panesar to Clarke, no run defended firmly on the front foot
Panesar to Clarke, no run lovely flight from Monty
Panesar to Clarke, no run defended solidly on the front foot
Panesar to Clarke, no run tossed on his leg stump and turned through midwicket
Panesar to Clarke, no run defended on the front foot
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run defended on the front foot
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run good line, just outside off and turning back into the batsman who whips it to leg
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run ooh well bowled - this hurries the right hander who is quickly back into his crease and defending
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run nicely bowled again from Dalrymple
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run pushed off the back foot into the covers
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run jaffa! Ponting comes forward but it's the arm ball from Dalrymple and he's comprehensively beaten
Panesar to Clarke, 1 run short and wide of the right-hander's off stump, cut off the back foot
Panesar to Ponting, FOUR runs right up in the blockhole and Ponting eases this, with perfect timing, over Monty's head, over long-off and it falls just short of the rope
Panesar to Ponting, 1 run turned off his legs
Panesar to Clarke, 2 runs on leg stump and Clarke turns it off his legs
Panesar to Clarke, no run on middle-and-leg, Clarke tries to whip it to leg but can't time it
Panesar to Clarke, no run pushed out into the covers
Dalrymple to Ponting, no run outside off, Ponting comes forward and angles this to cover
Dalrymple to Ponting, 1 run turned to leg
Dalrymple to Clarke, no run firmly defended on the front foot
Dalrymple to Ponting, 1 run Ponting comes forward and pushes it to mid on
Dalrymple to Clarke, no run clunked to the bowler's right who dives, athletically and fields

Australia are on course here. Bad news for England. Pietersen is out of tour due to that blow to his ribs while batting.
Australia won by 8 wickets (with 28 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Adam Gilchrist, AUS
